page.title: 17Littlecote House
page.content: brick.It is 17th century. There are also three panels one of the panels leads to a secret passage .We then went and saw the chapel. {"The Chapel" The Chapel seats are very hard they did not have cushions and you had to sit up straight and you must not laugh or giggle You had 1 to 4 hour services Then we went along to get another place. {"The Haunted Landing And Bedroom" The guide told us the story about the ghost of Littlecote. One night a mid-wife was sent on horse back blindfolded to Littlecote to look after a mother who was about to have a baby. When she got there she was lead upstairs still blindfolded to the mother. Then the midwife brought the baby out onto the landing, where William Darrell was standing. He
